Hate the ruling class - Have you looked into Incredibly Average? I have never been a fan of Amber Heard even before all of this started and after watching his videos (he stays unbiased and looks at ALL of the evidence, not just Depps) it seems pretty clear who abused who. Amber literally admits to hitting him and throwing pots and pans at him. You know what she says Depp does when she start yelling at him? He does the gentlemanly thing to do and walks away. And that is what pisses her off. He says a man would want to walk away and settle himself down before he does actually "pop the fuckin wife." He tries to de-escalate the situation. In the recordings Amber is non-stop losing her mind and yelling at Depp while he remains calm and tries to rationally speak to her. She constantly doesn't let him speak. When he gets some words in and asks her even simple yes or no questions she can't give him a straight answer. She proclaims that he is such an abusive person, crazy, and that him walking away from fights is "cowerdly" she calls him a "baby" because he doesn't want to get into fights and wants to go cool down. In one of the recordings she can be heard taking out some xanax and giving it to him saying  that it seemed like the last one had worn off. Not really something she can know, and on top of that, too many of those in succession can be fatal. No matter what point Depp brings up she re-directs it to say something about her. She says she is only worried about her reputation after he brings up what is going on with his children. His son has to go to school and here "so your dad is a wife beater?" That's awful for a step-mother/ex step-mother to do. Seems really narcissistic to me. Now I don't know for sure because I wasn't there but I really feel like Depp is not the evil one here. Sure it could be a possibility that he isn't entirely innocent. Whatever. That doesn't change the fact that she admitted to throwing pots, pans, bottles hitting him with a closed fist, almost cutting off the tip of his finger, ect. The witnesses that Amber has are many times contradicting each other and the pictures that she has, Incredibly Average, shows that they are not from the places she claims they are. And going to do an interview show the day after taking pictures of her bruises and split lip? Watch the interview and tell me it wouldn't hurt like hell to make the faces she does in it. And there doesn't seem to be any bruising/split lip, and she does not have the make-up caked on either so that claim really doesn't hold up. Anyway, look up Incredibly Average, watch the videos in their entirety, then come back and try to support your claims. Seems to me that you have only looked at one side of the story. Almost forgot to mention that Depp has had zero history with DV and all of his ex's attest to that. On the flip side Amber has arrest charges for DV with her ex girlfriend so what is more likely, a man with no domestic violence charges suddenly starting to beat the crap out of his wife even though multiple of his ex's say that he is one of the most loving, caring, and gentle souls, or a woman who has had a history of DV in the past? Just putting that into prospective. 
Before you start saying "you are a Depp supporter so your opinion is invalid," I am not idolizing him, I enjoy his POTC movies and Edward Scissor Hands, but those are the only films I have seen of his. I am just pointing out that there seems to be more to the case than you seem to know. Not attacking you, just trying to let you know that you may not know the whole truth and neither do I. We won't know until the court has reached a decision so before you tell people they are wrong, look into it more and follow the whole case from beginning to end. Cheers.

‚Äã@tra lala The problem I have with the Depp version of the story is that if you look at the uncensored picture it in no way looks like the sort of injury you could get from a thrown bottle as he described. How would a thrown bottle cut off the very tip only? It would have to break, which honestly it probably wouldn't against a soft hand, and then when it did the pieces would not be able to slice all the way through a finger, which they couldn't as glass has thickness so cannot generally actually chop through something like a knife can it can only slice the surface. Also, it it weird that there was only the one injury on his whole hand, surely if there was flying glass that could slice through a finger it would be a miracle that the rest of the hand is untouched. Just to address the "break" this is not necessarily indicative of an impact injury rather than a cut in this case, as with the tip being cut off it is very common to break the bone at the end of your finger.

Tbh, the story about cutting off your own finger, dipping the severed (that would be seriously bleeding!) digit in paint (most likely toxic) and writing with it always seemed fishy to me.
